topic.title: Access a Bucket
topic.shortdesc: To access a bucket, administrators and applications must use the Couchbase Role-Based Access Control system. This requires that appropriate credentials be passed, and the administrator or application thereby authorized, for access to be granted.

section.title: Testing User-Access
section.p: Using the Couchbase Web Console, you can set up buckets, create users, and assign users roles that allow them to access the buckets you have created. You can test the results by means of N1QL queries, executed by means of the cbq tool. You can do this in three stages:

ol.li: Create a bucket containing documents, different levels of access to which can be assigned to different users. This is described in the section Create and Populate a Bucket.
Create users with different role-combinations. See Create Users and Assign Roles.
Use the cbq tool to test bucket-access, according to the roles you have assigned to users. See Perform cbq Access Tests.
